required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Application of Megavoltage Imaging to Reduce Artifact After Seed Implants
clinical_study.official_title: Application of Megavoltage Imaging to Reduce Artifact Following Interstitial Seed Implants for Prostate Adenocarcinoma

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

brief_summary.textblock: This is a non-randomized study to evaluate the utility of MVCT as a quality assurance measure in patients treated with interstitial permanent seed implants for low and intermediate risk prostate cancer. All patients will received the same standard of care treatment but will receive an additinoal CT image of the prostate.

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Diagnostic

primary_outcome.measure: Change in prostate volume measured in cm^3
primary_outcome.description: Change in prostate volume measured with trans-rectal ultrasound at baseline versus prostate volume measured with KVCT and MVCT.

arm_group.description: Patients will receive an additional MVCT scan at their one month follow up visit.

intervention.description: Patients will receive an additional MVCT scan at their one month follow up visit.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Male 50-80 years of age Eligible for interstitial brachytherapy implants
Exclusion Criteria:
-

overall_official.affiliation: Lucille P. Markey Cancer Center at University of Kentucky
